title: Smell
data:
There are many situations where your character might **smell** something.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Shapeshifting monsters](#Shapeshifting_monsters)

- [2 Other messages involving smell](#Other_messages_involving_smell)

  - [2.1 Food appraisal](#Food_appraisal)
  - [2.2 Food detection](#Food_detection)
  - [2.3 Level smells](#Level_smells)
  - [2.4 Stone to flesh](#Stone_to_flesh)
  - [2.5 Magic trap](#Magic_trap)
  - [2.6 Burning](#Burning)
  - [2.7 Potions](#Potions)
  - [2.8 Miscellaneous](#Miscellaneous)

- [3 References](#References)

## Shapeshifting monsters

If a monster shapeshifts into something you can no longer detect, you might smell its new form. You can smell monsters only if you are *not* polymorphed into any [blob](/wiki/Blob "Blob"), [eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"), [sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere"), [jelly](/wiki/Jelly "Jelly"), [vortex](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex"), [light](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)"), [elemental](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") (including invisible stalkers), [fungus](/wiki/Fungus "Fungus") or [pudding](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This may give one of the following messages:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

| Message                                              | Monster                                                                                                                        |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| *You notice a bovine smell.*                         | [Rothe](/wiki/Rothe "Rothe") or [minotaur](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur")                                                          |
| *You smell body odor.*                               | [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), [barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") or [neanderthal](/wiki/Neanderthal "Neanderthal") |
| *You detect an odor reminiscent of an animal's den.* | Any [werecreature](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") or [owlbear](/wiki/Owlbear "Owlbear")                                    |
| *You smell steam.*                                   | [Steam vortex](/wiki/Steam_vortex "Steam vortex")                                                                              |
| *Something stinks.*                                  | [Green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime")                                                                                 |
| *You smell mushrooms.*                               | [Violet fungus](/wiki/Violet_fungus "Violet fungus") or [shrieker](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker")                                  |
| *You notice a dog smell.*                            | Any [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine") other than a werecreature                                                                  |
| *You smell a dragon!*                                | Any [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon"), including baby dragons                                                                    |
| *Something smells moldy.*                            | Any [fungus](/wiki/Fungus "Fungus") other than a violet fungus or shrieker                                                     |
| *You detect an odor reminiscent of a stable.*        | [Pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony")                                                                                                      |
| *You detect a strong odor reminiscent of a stable.*  | [Horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse") or [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse")                                                          |
| *You smell rotting flesh.*                           | Any [zombie](/wiki/Zombie "Zombie")                                                                                            |
| *You smell fish.*                                    | Any [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") other than a jellyfish                                                      |
| *A foul stench makes you feel a little nauseated.*   | Any [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)"). This does not actually cause nausea.                             |
| *You notice an attractive smell.*                    | Any [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)"), if you are also currently an orc.                                |
| *That monster seems to give off no smell.*           | Any other monster, if you used the #wizsmell command in [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode").                        |

## Other messages involving smell

The following other messages are associated with a sense of smell. These appear even if you are in a form that cannot smell monsters.

### Food appraisal

- *Main article: [food appraisal](/wiki/Food_appraisal "Food appraisal")*

* * The \<food> smells like it could be tainted!
  * The \<food> smells like it could be something very dangerous!

  You tried to eat something that would [turn you to stone](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") or [slime](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming").

* - The \<food> smells like it could be rotten!
  - The \<food> smells like it might be poisonous!
  - The apple smells like it might have been poisoned.

  You tried to eat a cursed [apple](/wiki/Apple "Apple") without [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

* The \<food> smells unhealthy.

  You tried to eat something non-[vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") as a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), having kept to the conduct so far.

* - The \<food> smells rather acidic.
  - The \<food> smells disgusting to you right now.

  You are polymorphed into a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster") and tried to eat a [rustproof](/wiki/Rustproof "Rustproof") item.

* The \<food> smells foul and unfamiliar to you.

  You tried to eat something non-[vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") having kept to the conduct so far.

* The \<food> smells unfamiliar to you.

  You tried to eat something non-[vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") having kept to the conduct so far.

### Food detection

- *Main article: [Scroll of food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection")*

* Your \<nose> tingles and you smell food.

  You read a non-cursed [scroll of food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection") or cast [detect food](/wiki/Detect_food "Detect food"), and detected food.

* Your \<nose> \<starts/continues> to tingle and you smell food.

  You read a blessed scroll of food detection or cast skilled [detect food](/wiki/Detect_food "Detect food"), detected food and gained [food appraisal](/wiki/Food_appraisal "Food appraisal") if you did not already have it.

* Your \<nose> tingles and you smell something.

  You read a cursed scroll of food detection, or any scroll while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), and detected potions.

* You smell food nearby.

  You read a non-cursed scroll of food detection or cast [detect food](/wiki/Detect_food "Detect food"), and detected food only on your square.

* You smell something nearby.

  You read a cursed scroll of food detection, or any scroll while confused, and detected potions only on your square.

### Level smells

- The odor of burnt flesh and decay pervades the air.

  You entered the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") from outside Gehennom.

- It is hot here. You smell smoke...

  You entered [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") at somewhere other than the Valley, most likely by leaving [Vlad's tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_tower "Vlad's tower").

- You smell marsh gas!

  There is a [swamp](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp") on the level.

### Stone to flesh

- *Main article: [Spellbook of stone to flesh](/wiki/Spellbook_of_stone_to_flesh "Spellbook of stone to flesh")*

* You smell the odor of meat.

  You cast [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh"), turning an object into a comestible (instead of a monster), and you are a monk, vegetarian or polymorphed into a non-carnivore.

* You smell a delicious smell.

  You cast [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh"), turning an object into a comestible, and you are *not* monk, vegetarian or polymorphed into a non-carnivore.

### Magic trap

- *Main article: [Magic trap](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap")*

* You smell charred flesh.

  One of the effects of a [magic trap](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap"). No effect.

* You smell hamburgers.

  As above, but you are hallucinating.

### Burning

- You smell smoke.

  Some items or a door burned up out of your sight.

- You smell a whiff of smoke.

  A bolt of fire burned some items out of your sight.

- You smell paper burning.

  A [fire trap](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap") burned up an object nearby, but out of your sight. This appears even if the destroyed object is a glob of green slime.

- You smell burning \<paper/straw>.

  You hit a [paper golem](/wiki/Paper_golem "Paper golem") or [straw golem](/wiki/Straw_golem "Straw golem") with a fire attack while blind, destroying it instantly.

### Potions

- You smell a peculiar odor...

  You were affected by a thrown [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion"). This does not appear if you are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing").

- Ulch! That potion smells terrible!

  You were affected by vapors from a cursed [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability") or [potion of gain ability](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_ability "Potion of gain ability"). This does not appear if you are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing").

- You smell acrid fumes.

  A [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni") was released from a [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion"), and you are blind.

### Miscellaneous

- You smell rotten \<fruit>.

  You dropped a [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") into a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink").

- You smell stale honey.

  Kicking a [tree](/wiki/Tree "Tree") would have released [killer bees](/wiki/Killer_bees "Killer bees"), but none could be created.

- It smells like \<monster type>.

  You opened a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") and smell the contents. Beware: if you are [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating"), and the tin does not contain chickatrice or cockatrice meat, you will smell a random monster type instead.

- Overall, there is a smell of fried onions.

  You sacrificed while hallucinating, and your prayer timeout was lowered to zero. This also raises your natural [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") to zero if it was negative.

- You smell rotten eggs.

  You read a [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud"), but did not choose a valid target for the cloud.

## References

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [olfaction](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mondata.c#olfaction "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mondata.c") in [mondata.c](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mondata.c "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mondata.c") in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [usmellmon](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mon.c#usmellmon "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mon.c") in [mon.c](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mon.c "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mon.c") in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1")
html:
Smell

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

There are many situations where your character might smell something.

Contents

  • 1 Shapeshifting monsters
  • 2 Other messages involving smell
    • 2.1 Food appraisal
    • 2.2 Food detection
    • 2.3 Level smells
    • 2.4 Stone to flesh
    • 2.5 Magic trap
    • 2.6 Burning
    • 2.7 Potions
    • 2.8 Miscellaneous
  • 3 References

Shapeshifting monsters

If a monster shapeshifts into something you can no longer detect, you might smell its new form. You can smell monsters only if you are not polymorphed into any blob, eye, sphere, jelly, vortex, light, elemental (including invisible stalkers), fungus or pudding.[1] This may give one of the following messages:[2]

Message Monster
You notice a bovine smell. Rothe or minotaur
You smell body odor. Caveman, barbarian or neanderthal
You detect an odor reminiscent of an animal's den. Any werecreature or owlbear
You smell steam. Steam vortex
Something stinks. Green slime
You smell mushrooms. Violet fungus or shrieker
You notice a dog smell. Any canine other than a werecreature
You smell a dragon! Any dragon, including baby dragons
Something smells moldy. Any fungus other than a violet fungus or shrieker
You detect an odor reminiscent of a stable. Pony
You detect a strong odor reminiscent of a stable. Horse or warhorse
You smell rotting flesh. Any zombie
You smell fish. Any sea monster other than a jellyfish
A foul stench makes you feel a little nauseated. Any orc. This does not actually cause nausea.
You notice an attractive smell. Any orc, if you are also currently an orc.
That monster seems to give off no smell. Any other monster, if you used the #wizsmell command in wizard mode.

Other messages involving smell

The following other messages are associated with a sense of smell. These appear even if you are in a form that cannot smell monsters.

Food appraisal

Main article: food appraisal
The <food> smells like it could be tainted!
The <food> smells like it could be something very dangerous!
You tried to eat something that would turn you to stone or slime.
The <food> smells like it could be rotten!
The <food> smells like it might be poisonous!
The apple smells like it might have been poisoned.
You tried to eat a cursed apple without sleep resistance.
The <food> smells unhealthy.
You tried to eat something non-vegetarian as a Monk, having kept to the conduct so far.
The <food> smells rather acidic.
The <food> smells disgusting to you right now.
You are polymorphed into a rust monster and tried to eat a rustproof item.
The <food> smells foul and unfamiliar to you.
You tried to eat something non-vegan having kept to the conduct so far.
The <food> smells unfamiliar to you.
You tried to eat something non-vegetarian having kept to the conduct so far.

Food detection

Main article: Scroll of food detection
Your <nose> tingles and you smell food.
You read a non-cursed scroll of food detection or cast detect food, and detected food.
Your <nose> <starts/continues> to tingle and you smell food.
You read a blessed scroll of food detection or cast skilled detect food, detected food and gained food appraisal if you did not already have it.
Your <nose> tingles and you smell something.
You read a cursed scroll of food detection, or any scroll while confused, and detected potions.
You smell food nearby.
You read a non-cursed scroll of food detection or cast detect food, and detected food only on your square.
You smell something nearby.
You read a cursed scroll of food detection, or any scroll while confused, and detected potions only on your square.

Level smells

The odor of burnt flesh and decay pervades the air.
You entered the Valley of the Dead from outside Gehennom.
It is hot here. You smell smoke...
You entered Gehennom at somewhere other than the Valley, most likely by leaving Vlad's tower.
You smell marsh gas!
There is a swamp on the level.

Stone to flesh

Main article: Spellbook of stone to flesh
You smell the odor of meat.
You cast stone to flesh, turning an object into a comestible (instead of a monster), and you are a monk, vegetarian or polymorphed into a non-carnivore.
You smell a delicious smell.
You cast stone to flesh, turning an object into a comestible, and you are not monk, vegetarian or polymorphed into a non-carnivore.

Magic trap

Main article: Magic trap
You smell charred flesh.
One of the effects of a magic trap. No effect.
You smell hamburgers.
As above, but you are hallucinating.

Burning

You smell smoke.
Some items or a door burned up out of your sight.
You smell a whiff of smoke.
A bolt of fire burned some items out of your sight.
You smell paper burning.
A fire trap burned up an object nearby, but out of your sight. This appears even if the destroyed object is a glob of green slime.
You smell burning <paper/straw>.
You hit a paper golem or straw golem with a fire attack while blind, destroying it instantly.

Potions

You smell a peculiar odor...
You were affected by a thrown potion. This does not appear if you are unbreathing.
Ulch! That potion smells terrible!
You were affected by vapors from a cursed potion of restore ability or potion of gain ability. This does not appear if you are unbreathing.
You smell acrid fumes.
A djinni was released from a smoky potion, and you are blind.

Miscellaneous

You smell rotten <fruit>.
You dropped a ring of poison resistance into a sink.
You smell stale honey.
Kicking a tree would have released killer bees, but none could be created.
It smells like <monster type>.
You opened a tin and smell the contents. Beware: if you are hallucinating, and the tin does not contain chickatrice or cockatrice meat, you will smell a random monster type instead.
Overall, there is a smell of fried onions.
You sacrificed while hallucinating, and your prayer timeout was lowered to zero. This also raises your natural luck to zero if it was negative.
You smell rotten eggs.
You read a scroll of stinking cloud, but did not choose a valid target for the cloud.

References

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.
